nuhker

Class Run

  • java.lang.Object
    • nuhker.Run

  • public class Run
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class to launch from CLI considering the options. No multi-threading at all. It takes CLI Grammar, stores it in a data class and then calls DataDiver.main(DefaultParms modified) to do the actual work created Nov 23, 2014 12:44:46 AM
    Version:
    0.8 so far
    Author:
    coder037@xyz.ee

    • Method Detail

      • checkConformity

        public static boolean checkConformity(java.lang.String[] arguments)
        Depends on the jopt-simple library. Take a copy of the CLIGrammar and then validate the actual CLI options according to the grammar. No attempt is made to understand the options - this is the preliminar pass. If it seems to the library that options are correct and adhere to the Grammar, then we return Boolean true, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        arguments - - a copy of CLI options to be validated
        Returns:
        decision whether the conformancy was true or false

      • parseContent

        public static DefaultParms parseContent(java.lang.String[] arguments)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This is the utmost important method of the class. CLI options are parsed by means of the jopt-simple library and recorded into DefaultParms runTimeParms options.
        Parameters:
        arguments - to be parsed as options, taken straight from CLI
        Returns:
        an object Runtimes of type DefaultParameter that all DataDiver recursions will be called with
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - which has left mostly unhandled. The reason - a PoC code.

      • loggingBlock

        public static void loggingBlock(DefaultParms values)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        The main routine parses CLI options from the command line argv and sets the running options according these. Some simulated CLI option examples are left commented out.
        Parameters:
        argv - CLI options passed to other methods
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - which left properly unhandled - b/c this is a PoC code.
